data.title: Submit to Speak at SOSS Community Day North America 2024 – Open Source Security Foundation
data.text:
We are thrilled to announce that the OpenSSF is hosting SOSS Community Day North America 2024, on April 15, 2024 in Seattle, Washington. This is a one day event co-located with Open Source Summit North America dedicated to Securing Open Source Software (SOSS). The call for proposals (CFPs) to speak is currently open.

SOSS Community Day North America 2024 (formerly known as OpenSSF Day) will provide a full day of engaging discussions and insights into the challenges, innovations, and collaborative efforts shaping the security landscape of open source software. The event aims to bring together experts, enthusiasts, and thought leaders to explore topics such as security best practices, threat intelligence, safeguarding critical projects, and the future trajectory of open source software security.

What: SOSS Community Day NA 2024

When: April 15, 2024

Where: Seattle Convention Center – Summit Building: Signature Room, 5th floor, 900 Pine St. Seattle, WA 98101

Call for Proposals

We invite individuals or teams that are passionate about open source software security to submit proposals for presentations at SOSS Community Day NA 2024. If you have valuable insights, research findings, or success stories related to advancing the security of open source software, we want to hear from you. Our CFP is open until February 9, 2024, and we encourage submissions covering a range of topics, including progress reports from the SOSS community, experiences from organizations using SOSS results, and presentations exploring collaborations in the open source software security ecosystem.

Sponsorship Opportunities

Interested in supporting this pivotal gathering of open source software security enthusiasts? Explore our sponsorship opportunities and be a key contributor to the success of SOSS Community Day. Contact events@openssf.org to learn more about how your organization can become a valued sponsor. Sponsorship deadline: March 10, 2024

Tabletop Exercise (TTX)

OpenSSF will be organizing a Tabletop Exercise (TTX) as part of the SOSS Community Day. The goal is to improve incident response overall by:

Offering a comprehensive TTX template/formula for maintainers, contributors, and open source consumers to enhance incident response capabilities and overall security posture.

Providing educational content for developers who are in the process of learning about security practices.

Showcasing the practical applications of current OpenSSF technologies in the context of a security incident.

Identifying opportunities for refining existing processes and technologies, as well as exploring the development of new ones that can bolster incident response efforts.

See you in Seattle!

We look forward to welcoming you to the vibrant city of Seattle for a day filled with knowledge-sharing, networking, and collaborative discussions on Securing Open Source Software. Save the date and stay tuned for further updates as we curate an agenda that promises to inspire and empower our community.
